list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The road curved and then straightened.

list_ex_of_english: The matter needs straightening out, and it is about time that something was done to put them on a par.
They are playing about straightening a corner, but this is a shocking road from the point of view of alignment and narrowness.
Is he further aware that there is occasionally a delay in the straightening out of the needs between the two granting authorities.
I should like to know how effectively these things have been straightened out.
I know of no policy of widening and straightening all by-roads.
I think we had better get it straightened out; it is to our mutual advantage to do so.
Are we to assume that the whole world has got to be straightened out before we abolish conscription in this country?
Meanwhile, he spared no effeort in straightening up the administrative and militiary affairs in the area.
